page.title: 03LOWESWATER LAKE.
page.content: Loweswater Lake is 1.8km long with a maximum depth of 16m and a volume of 5.4 million cu.m. It is not directly used for water supply, but discharges into Crummock (ref. page 2). Loweswater is owned by the National Trust who issue fishing permits for Â£2.00 per day obtainable from Scale Hill Hotel. Rowing boats can also be hired for Â£10.00 per day.Car park facilities are available for fishermen & boat users close to an area known as Swans Nest where the boats are kept. The N.T. stocks the lake with Trout, the Water Authority with Salmon but Pike & Char occur naturally. The area around Loweswater is of great natural beauty and attracts many tourists, principally fell walkers. Use of the manyfootpaths and rights of way being perhaps, the best way of appreciating the scenery.
